subject: Ruby on Rails
name: Rails for Zombies Redux
description: Videos followed by interactive exercises covering CRUD, models, views, controllers and routes

subject: Ruby on Rails
name: Rails for Zombies 2
description: Learn more Rails with this sequel to the infamous Rails for Zombies course. Increase your Ruby on Rails knowledge with even more zombie learning.

subject: Ruby on Rails
name: Agile Web Development With Rails 4
description:
Rails just keeps on changing. Both Rails 3 and 4, as well as Ruby 1.9 and 2.0, bring hundreds of improvements, including new APIs and substantial performance enhancements. The fourth edition of this award-winning classic has been reorganized and refocused so it’s more useful than ever before for developers new to Ruby and Rails.

Rails 4 introduces a number of user-facing changes, and the ebook has been updated to match all the latest changes and new best practices in Rails. This includes full support for Ruby 2.0, controller concerns, Russian Doll caching, strong parameters, Turbolinks, new test and bin directory layouts, and much more.

subject: Ruby on Rails
name: Ruby on Rails Tutorial
description: The Ruby on Rails Tutorial book and screencast series teach you how to develop and deploy real, industrial-strength web applications with Ruby on Rails, the open-source web framework that powers top websites such as Twitter, Hulu, GitHub, and the Yellow Pages.

subject: Ruby on Rails, Test-Driven Development
name: Rails Testing for Zombies
description: Learn Rails testing for your applications with these testing fundamentals. Brush up on testing best practices with Rails Testing for Zombies.

subject: Ruby on Rails, Test-Driven Development, RSpec
name: Testing with RSpec
description: Testing with RSpec will introduce you to the RSpec syntax and configuration, and to the concept of Behavior-driven development. We’ll show you how RSpec helps you refactor, organize and DRY up your tests with hooks, shared examples and custom matchers. We’ll also look at how to create specific contexts within your specs, with expressive examples and expectations to help you describe how your Ruby or Rails application should function. The course also features a refresher on Mocks & Stubs, to ensure that your tests are properly decoupled.

subject: Ruby on Rails
name: Rails 4: Zombie Outlaws
description: Learn to build faster and more secure web apps with Rails 4. Review the Rails updates that will help get your apps up to speed on Rails 4 best practices.

subject: Ruby on Rails
name: Installing Rails
description:
Installing Ruby on Rails 4.0 on Mac OS X, Ubuntu, or Windows. Up-to-date, detailed instructions on how to install Rails newest release. 4.0.0 is the newest version of Rails.

These installation guides are used by professional developers to configure their working environment for real-world Rails development.

subject: jQuery
name: Try jQuery
description: Learn the basic building blocks of jQuery 2.0 and enjoy new video tutorials for beginners with related programming challenges.

subject: jQuery, AJAX

description: Learn Ajax and add more interactivity to your projects. Discover how to organize your code using jQuery Plugins and Promises.

subject: Coffeescript
name: Coffeescript
description: CoffeeScript is a new programming language which compiles into JavaScript. Inspired by languages like Ruby and Python, it allows you to write less code to get more done. Caike Souza and Gregg Pollack joined forces to bring you 6 videos and 36 code challenges.

subject: Javascript

subject: Git

subject: Git
